description._content: Author: Tolman, Ruel P (Ruel Pardee) b. 1878 Subject: Crossingham, William Type: Photographic print     Person, candid Date: 1935 Topic: Windows Standard number: SIA2011-0484 and 32070 Physical description: Number of Images: 1 Color: Black and White ; Size: 2.25w x 2.25h ; Type of Image: Person, Candid ; Medium: Photographic print Category: Historic Images of the Smithsonian Notes: The image was taken by Ruel P. Tolman, Director of Smithsonian National Collection of Fine Arts, and is included in a scrapbook of photographs of Smithsonian staff, grounds and buildings, exhibitions, and Washington, D.C. scenes (Section C) Summary: Image of Mr. William Crossingham. Crossingham is wearing bib overalls with suspenders. A window can be seen in the background. Crossingham served on the Smithsonian's maintenance and operation staff as foreman of the paint shop. He retired on September 30, 1944. Persistent URL:Link to data base record Repository:Smithsonian Archives - History Div View more collections from the Smithsonian Institution.
